display.shortDescription: An easy starter pressure profile for espresso for light-medium to dark beans.
display.description: A pressure profile in the same style as the default Gentle & Sweet profile on Decent machines.  It was intended to help if you are having issues making good drinks with suboptimal puck preparation by raising the pressure to only 6 bar and then descending to 4 to reduce odds of channeling, lower acidity, and provide something that could be enjoyed straight or with milk. Target your grind size to hit the exit pressure in preinfusion before the max timer, and to approach the target extraction pressure in the hold stage.  For light roasts, keep the shot quick by going as course as you can while hitting the 2 pressure targets during their stages.  The resulting shot graph should ideally show ramping the pressure to the preinfusion target with a  the flow, followed by holding the pressure constant by slowly increasing flow as the puck erodes until the target yield is reached.  You can see an example of pulling this shot with light beans on a Decent at https://www.youtube.com/live/lJjpleB2vhs?t=354s
